comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Download and unpack eclipse europe
2. Run eclipse
3. Create new Java project
4. Create simple class with one System.out.println(1);
5. Launch it and it work :)
6. debug it and it won't work


More information:
I'm using now eclipse 3.2.2 cause it's don't have this problem on my machine. And same unpacked eclipse work without any problem on my home machine.

System: windows XP SP2 (clean - just installed, with disabled windows firewall)
JRE: 1.5.0_12, 1.6.0_u2 on both of them same trouble

When I launch debug application I have 2 stack traces (one from eclipsec.exe console):
Exception in thread "Listening Connector" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportService.accept(Socket
TransportService.java:92)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept(SocketTra
nsportImpl.java:56)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(
SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:135)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable
.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:88)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) 

next one from eclipse error log:

java.net.SocketException: socket closed
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(Unknown Source)
at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(Unknown Source)
at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportService.accept(SocketTransportService.java:95)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept(SocketTransportImpl.java:56)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:135)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:88)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

and console output from eclipse where must be application output:
FATAL ERROR in native method: JDWP No transports initialized, jvmtiError=JVMTI_ERROR_INTERNAL(113)
ERROR: transport error 202: gethostbyname: unknown host ["transport.c",L41]
ERROR: JDWP Transport dt_socket failed to initialize, TRANSPORT_INIT(510) ["debugInit.c",L500]
JDWP exit error JVMTI_ERROR_INTERNAL(113): No transports initialized
This generally indicates a configuration problem on your local machine. Do you have any firewalls preventing TCP? Have you changed anything on the Environment tab that effects your system path?
this smells like a dupe of 136215
No I don't have any firewalls and I don't change anything in Evironment Tab

I found the way, how anyone can reproduce this bug and how anyone can fix this bug.

By default Eclipse found my JRE at "C:\jdk1.5.0_12\jre" (it's private SDK JRE)
but if I try edit installed environment I found what JRE home directory have wrong path "C:\jdk1.5.0_12"


I just added "\jre" and all work fine.

In eclipse 3.2.2 all work fine without "\jre"

(In reply to comment #4)
> I just added "\jre" and all work fine.

Where did you add the "\jre"? on a system environment variable? or on the installed JRE's home directory in Eclipse?

(In reply to comment #5)
> (In reply to comment #4)
> > I just added "\jre" and all work fine.
> 
> on the installed JRE's home directory in Eclipse?

OK this is a dup of a problem fixed with bug 195185 (which is fixed in the 3.3.1 maintenance stream). You could download the latest maintenance build to verify the fix works for you.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 195185 ***
